attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
I was, in fact, raised by wolves.

I’m driven by a wanderlust that led me away from home.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Greater Good. It is each person’s responsibility to make the most happiness for the whole tribe. (Good)

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I suffer awful visions of a coming disaster and will do anything to prevent it.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: There’s no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVr4aV3wal0EXn7YIST_description
attribs.current: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVr4aV5iyE1XKcZ0l-q_description
attribs.current: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVr4aV5iyE1XKcZ0l-r_description
attribs.current: Blessed with a radiant soul, your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVr4aV5iyE1XKcZ0l-s_description
attribs.current: You have resistance to necrotic damage and radiant damage.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVr4aV5iyE1XKcZ0l-t_description
attribs.current: As an action, you can touch a creature and cause it to regain a number of hit points equal to your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVr4aV6sLhNvZZxbulv_description
attribs.current: You know the light cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVr4aV7KMhARlVqwFso_description
attribs.current: You have an excellent memory for maps and geography, and you can always recall the general layout of terrain, settlements, and other features around you. In addition, you can find food and fresh water for yourself and up to five other people each day, provided that the land offers berries, small game, water, and so forth.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aV8kRYzgkrLYtPH_itemname
attribs.current: Trophy from an Animal You Killed

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVA2czH8yFfr4sM_itemcontent
attribs.current: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVA2czH8yFfr4sM_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Light Armor, AC: 12 + DEX

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVBAvvvlhKXODG9_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 150/600,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVBAvvvlhKXODGA_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVBAvvvlhKXODGB_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVBAvvvlhKXODGC_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVBAvvvlhKXODGD_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Slashing, Range: 20/60,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVBAvvvlhKXODGE_itemcontent
attribs.current: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, using it in place of any material component which does not list a cost.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVCmnyJc25SmIJ2_itemcontent
attribs.current: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVCmnyJc25SmIJ2_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: Piercing

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MVr4aVDRHHn0wjc0tha_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action. If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MVr4aVDRHHn0wjc0tha_spelltarget
attribs.current: One object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVEohH1ZkZNTJcs_itemcontent
attribs.current: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVEohH1ZkZNTJcu_itemcontent
attribs.current: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVEohH1ZkZNTJcv_itemcontent
attribs.current: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVFa8O7aYDQbRKO_itemcontent
attribs.current: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVFa8O7aYDQbRKO_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 1, Damage Type: Fire, Range: 20/40

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVGY13q-JGj0jPz_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVGY13q-JGj0jQ-_itemcontent
attribs.current: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVr4aVGY13q-JGj0jQ0_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVr4vOgUjZLPgKCEP05_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and a possible bonus action.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.
